intro: Cyanea obtusifolia, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 6 meters. Its leaves are broad and ovate, often with a waxy coating, and its flowers bloom year-round in the warm tropical climate. Cyanea obtusifolia plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing nectar for native pollinators.
